content:
I just created a new project with sushi --init and am getting errors. It seems that you need to set publisher name and url in sushi-config.yaml, otherwise the templates run into empty attribute errors from publisher (trying to set information in the page footers). Also, without a description for the sample MyPatient profile, I get a warning in the qa report (and two "attribute path" messages in publisher output).

It would be nice if the default project "just worked", especially for novices who don't know how to track down the errors.
do you want it to make coffee for you too?
Yeah we should try to minimize those errors and warnings if we can. I've added an issue for us to address that here. Thanks for finding it and alerting us.
No, @John Moehrke, your coffee is good enough.
Drat. I was hoping that HotBeverage would be a dependency of at least one other IG
me too. I know that sushi can create HotBeverage IG
